subject: Re: [junit] Testing Abstract Classes
msgSnippet: ... You and I are of one mind here. With that definition, and thinking of interfaces as Strategies, an Adapter is pretty clearly an empty ( do nothing )
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> > That's a different definition of Adapter than I'm used to (or a
> > different application).
>
> Ditto.
>
> Here is mine: an adapter is a class implementing with empty bodies some of
> or all the methods of an interface. You can extend Adapters when you only
> want to implement a few methods of an interface but not all of them.
>
> What's your definition, JB?

You and I are of one mind here. With that definition, and thinking of
interfaces as Strategies, an Adapter is pretty clearly an empty ("do
nothing") implementation of a Strategy.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
